fullText: Read More About: Broadway, F. Murray Abraham, Kristin Chenoweth, The Queen Of Versailles Jump to Comments ‘The Queen of Versailles’ Broadway Review: Kristin Chenoweth’s Electric Performance Can’t Save This Overly Ambitious Slog St. James Theatre, 1,710 seats, $441 top. Opened Nov. 9, 2025. Reviewed Nov. 5. Running time: 2HOURS 40 MINS. Crew: Based on Lauren Greenfield’s award-winning 2012 documentary film and the life stories of Jackie and David Siegel, The Queen of Versailles will feature music and lyrics by Academy Award winner Stephen Schwartz, book by Olivier Award Nominee Lindsey Ferrentino, music direction by Mary-Mitchell Campbell, choreography by Lauren Yalango-Grant and Christopher Cree Grant, and direction by Tony Award winner Michael Arden. Additionally, the production will include scenic & video design by Dane Laffrey, costume design by Christian Cowan, lighting design by Natasha Katz, sound design by Peter Hylenski, hair & wig design by Cookie Jordan, orchestrations by John Clancy, and casting by Stephen Kopel, CSA & Carrie Gardner, CSA at C12 Casting. Baseline Theatrical will serve as General Manager and Clarissa Marie Ligon will serve as Production Stage Manager. Cast: Kristin Chenoweth, F. Murray Abraham, Melody Butiu, Stephen DeRosa, Greg Hildreth, Tatum Grace Hopkins, Isabel Keating and Nina White. The company will also will be made up of Yeman Brown, David Aron Damane, Drew Elhamalawy, Christopher Gurr, KJ Hippensteel, Cassondra James, Andrew Kober, Jesse Kovarsky, Pablo David Laucerica, Travis Murad Leland, Ryah Nixon, Shea Renne, Michael McCorry Rose, Grace Slear, Anne Fraser Thomas, Jake Bentley Young and Sherie Rene Scott as Standby ‘Jackie’.
showScoreExcerpt: âIn a year when Broadway has given us genuinely ambitious work grappling with what it means to be American, "The Queen of Versailles" offers only spectacle without insight, a palace with no one home. What were they thinking?â

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Negative | Claude: The critic explicitly criticizes the show for being all surface with no depth, contrasting it unfavorably with other Broadway shows this year and ending with the dismissive 'What were they thinking?' | GPT-4o: The excerpt criticizes the show for lacking substance and insight, suggesting it is not worth seeing compared to other ambitious works. The rhetorical question 'What were they thinking?' further emphasizes the negative sentiment. | Gemini: The review excerpt is strongly negative, criticizing the show for lacking insight and substance. The question "What were they thinking?" further emphasizes the reviewer's disapproval.
